tool.name: velveth
tool.command:
velveth_jgi_wrapper.pl $output $output.extra_files_path $output.id $__new_file_path__
velveth
$output.extra_files_path
#if $Hash_Length.hash_select =="user_input" :
$Hash_Length.hash_length
#else :
`cat $Hash_Length.hash_range_file `
#end if
#for $i in $shortLibs:
-fmtAuto
$i.short.libtype
-$i.short_select
#if $i.short.libtype == '-shortPaired' :
#for $j in $i.short.files: $j.file #end for #else : $i.short.file #end if
#end for
#if $shortUseLong.shortSelectLong == "yes":
$shortUseLong.long.libtype
#for $i in $shortUseLong.long.files $i.filetype.select #end for
#for $i in $shortUseLong.long.files $i.filetype.file #end for
#end if
#if $reuse_Seq: -reuse_Sequences #end if
#if $reuse_binary : -reuse_binary #end if
#if $noHash : -noHash #end if
#if $create_binary : -create_binary #end if
$strand_specific

param.name: noHash
param.label: Just prepare Sequences file don't read hashs or make a Roadmaps file (default off)

param.name: create_binary
param.label: Create a binary CnyUnifiedSeq file (default off)

param.name: hash_length
param.label: Hash length. Odd numbers only. Maximum 75. Or min,max,increment as comma seperated values with no spaces

param.name: short_select
param.label: Read 2 separate files for paired reads or the file contains paired reads that are interleaved (default)

param.name: shortSelectLong
param.label: Do you have a long short libary

param.name: short_selectlong
param.label: Read 2 separate files for paired reads or the file contains paired reads that are interleaved (default)

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool preprocesses the sequence data using the specified hash length. A larger hash length increases sensitivity at the expense of read depth.
**Manual**
http://www.ebi.ac.uk/~zerbino/velvet/Manual.pdf
